intro: Cleome tenuis, commonly known as slender cleome, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in loose, terminal inflorescences. Its flowers are typically five-petaled and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Cleome tenuis is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
